subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: 2012 is not the end!
author: Frank Ratka

Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

From what I have read from people who study the Mayan calender is that 2012=
 is just a point in time that a large astronomical shift happens. It doesn'=
t point to disaster or anything else. These events have happened in the pas=
t and will happen far past the 2012 date. It is the doomsdayers and second-=
coming types who place the dark meaning to the date. 

They describe these =
astronomical events as things like eclipses, solor cycles, or comets and su=
ch. No legitimate study of the calendar has ever predicted a doomsday event=
.

Not my information, just what I read on the subject.

Thanx,

Frank R.

=



________________________________
From: April Abercrombie <april@abercrom=
bieghostresearch.com>
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thu, October 15, 20=
09 10:44:49 AM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: 2012 is not the end!

=A0 
[One t=
hing I think we can all agree on:=A0 one knows it all. Not me, not you, and=
 certainly not a collapsed MesoAmerican civilization. ]
=A0
I do.
=A0
=A0
J=
ust teasin' ;)
=A0
----- Original Message ----- 
>From: Rj 
>To: EVP-ITC@ya=
hoogroups .com 
>Sent: Thursday, October 15, 2009 8:46 AM
>Subject: Re: [EV=
P-ITC] Re: 2012 is not the end!
>
>=A0 
>F-S, I certainly hope I didn't off=
end you with anything I said.=A0 I certainly do not claim to be a braniac o=
r a know-it-all, as you have called me in your post.
>
>In fact I am saying=
 the opposite: I am saying that I do not know:=A0 I am saying I do not know=
 how anyone can believe these 2012 predictions when all they have is storie=
s and questionable claims.=A0 I don't know how they can believe this stuff =
when they actually DO have evidence that all the similar claims in the past=
 have been shown to be false. I do not know why they believe this claim is =
any more justified than all the others,
>
>I do not know how the group can =
say on its home page " It's one thing to be skeptical, it's another to igno=
re and deny all evidence.", yet it is the people who are certain of the 201=
2 prophecies that seem to be ignoring and denying evidence that it is only =
one more in a long line of unsupported failed predictions, not those who ar=
e skeptical of it.
>
>I do not know how it justifies you referring to me as=
=A0 a "wanne be brianiacs claiming to know all", when the group home page s=
uggests such attacks get people banned.=A0 I do not know how being skeptica=
l of a future prophecy makes one a know it all. And I do not know how promp=
ting people to judge for themselves makes me a know it all. 
>
>And I don't=
 know why the group home page says a good argument is ok, yet you start nam=
e-calling offended when someone questions something you do not agree with, =
or proposes a theory alternate to your own.
>
>So call me ignorant.=A0 Obvi=
ously I really don't know very much at all.=A0 
>
>But of the very few thin=
gs I do know, I now it is good to question, and not take everything, especi=
ally prophecies, at face value.=A0 And I know the best way to test a prophe=
cy, and the people making them, is to see if they actually come to pass.=A0=
 And I know that since no evidence can support a prophecy's truth until it =
comes to pass, and since all past end-of-world prophecies have no evidence =
of their success, that those who think they know something special about wh=
y 2012 is different, certainly know more than I.
>
>And so I hope they (or =
you, if you count yourself among them) will post your evidence, and your pr=
edictions, and your dates.=A0 And we won't have to argue about it.=A0 We ca=
n just put that person, and their predictions, and their dates, on our cale=
ndars, and judge when the date comes, who was really acting as a know-it-al=
l.=A0 
>
>One thing I think we can all agree on:=A0 one knows it all. Not m=
e, not you, and certainly not a collapsed MesoAmerican civilization.
>
>Rj
=
>
>
>
>
>

 All these groups are full of wanne be brianiacs claiming to know all, and =

ld. And that is not aimed at April!--RJ
>>
>>F-S

better take a closer look at your world, if nothing happens to change this =

top>F-S, I certainly hope I didn't offend you with anything I said.  I=
 certainly do not claim to be a braniac or a know-it-all, as you have calle=
d me in your post.<BR><BR>In fact I am saying the opposite: I am saying tha=
t I do not know:  I am saying I do not know how anyone can believe the=
se 2012 predictions when all they have is stories and questionable claims.&=
nbsp; I don't know how they can believe this stuff when they actually DO ha=
ve evidence that all the similar claims in the past have been shown to be f=
alse. I do not know why they believe this claim is any more justified than =
all the others,<BR><BR>I do not know how the group can say on its home page=
 " It's one thing to be skeptical, it's another to ignore and deny all evid=
ence.", yet it is the people who are certain of the 2012 prophecies that se=
em to be ignoring and denying evidence that it is only one more in a long l=
ine of unsupported failed predictions, not those who are
 skeptical of it.<=
BR><BR>I do not know how it justifies you referring to me as  a "wanne=
 be brianiacs claiming to know all", when the group home page suggests such=
 attacks get people banned.  I do not know how being skeptical of a fu=
ture prophecy makes one a know it all. And I do not know how prompting peop=

oposes a theory alternate to your own.<BR><BR>So call me ignorant.  Ob=
viously I really don't know very much at all.  <BR><BR>But of the very=
 few things I do know, I now it is good to question, and not take everythin=
g, especially prophecies, at face value.  And I know the best way to t=
est a prophecy, and the people making them, is to see if they actually come=
 to pass.  And I know that since no evidence
 can support a prophecy's=
 truth until it comes to pass, and since all past end-of-world prophecies h=
ave no evidence of their success, that those who think they know something =
special about why 2012 is different, certainly know more than I.<BR><BR>And=
 so I hope they (or you, if you count yourself among them) will post your e=
vidence, and your predictions, and your dates.  And we won't have to a=
rgue about it.  We can just put that person, and their predictions, an=
d their dates, on our calendars, and judge when the date comes, who was rea=
lly acting as a know-it-all.  <BR><BR>One thing I think we can all agr=
ee on:  one knows it all. Not me, not you, and certainly not a collaps=
ed MesoAmerican civilization.<BR><BR>Rj<BR><BR><BR><BR><BR><BR>--- On <B>We=
